intro: Cargila, commonly known as the ghost flower, is a rare and enigmatic plant native to the high-altitude regions of South America. It belongs to the family Bromeliaceae, which includes many epiphytic and terrestrial plants. The plant is characterized by its striking, translucent petals that resemble ghostly apparitions, hence its common name.
